os.fullpath: Operating System :: Grouping and Descriptive Categories :: All POSIX (Linux/BSD/UNIX-like OSes)

name: GamingPanel
short_description:
GamingPanel is a game server control panel. It uses a PHP/MySQL interface that controls an Server-Agent running on the Unix Servers hosting your games.
It is used to start/stop/monitor game server instances.

It allows users to administer a game server without having shell access.
Panel admins can lock down various features to users, like limit which IPs or ports can be used for each game.

You can be assigned a specific cpu priority and on multi cpu boxes, a game can be assigned to a specific CPU, allowing admins to balance servers across CPU cores.

Games are started as the user who owns them. So the agent will see that a given Gaming server is started by the owning user.
It will launch the game server as the user.
This is also useful if admins enforce some kind of user based qutoa policy like disk quota or ulimit settings in Linux/Unix.

Installations can be cloned from the web interface.
